team.name: BOINC.Italy
team.description:
BOINC.Italy: l'Italia nel calcolo distribuito. Entra anche tu a far parte della piÃ¹ grande community italiana.
BOINC.Italy Ã¨ la nuova "alleanza" di team ed utenti italiani creata allo scopo di unire le forze di tanti volontari, per diffondere il calcolo distribuito e portare sempre piÃ¹ in alto la nostra bandiera nelle classifiche mondiali. Un gruppo dove tutti possono confluire e riconoscersi. Qualsiasi team e utente puÃ² entrare a far parte di questa squadra impegnata nella continua acquisizione di informazioni sui progetti e nella divulgazione del calcolo distribuito come risorsa sempre piÃ¹ importante per la scienza.
Visitate il nostro portale all'indirizzo www.boincitaly.org ed entrate a far parte della piÃ¹ grande community italiana dedicata a BOINC.
Sul portale troverete informazioni e news sul team, su tutto quello che riguarda BOINC e sui vari progetti seguiti dal team. Inoltre ci sono le statistiche, la chat ed il forum dove potrete trovare aiuto e divertirvi con gli altri membri del team! E se partecipate giÃ  ad altre community online o fate giÃ  parte di un team unitevi a noi con la vostra squadra e supportate BOINC.Italy: manterrete la vostra identitÃ  di team ma, attraverso una community unita, aumenteremo il peso dell'Italia alla comunitÃ  scientifica internazionale. Per maggiori informazioni e per vedere l'elenco delle community che fanno parte di BOINC.Italy visitate questa pagina del portale. Invitiamo tutti gli italiani ad unirsi a questa grande iniziativa e partecipare attivamente al team tramite il nostro portale.
Per qualsiasi informazione e richiesta vi invitiamo a scrivere nel nostro forum.
Che state aspettando a supportare BOINC.Italy?
Insieme, con il vostro aiuto, possiamo fare ancora di piÃ¹!

team.name: SETI.USA
team.description:
Welcome to Team SETI.USA!

Our Motto:Together we will accomplish something amazing!

On March 24, 2005 Team SETI.USA was created to consolidate United States users and become the #1 SETI Team in the world.

This goal was achieved within 24 months of inception thanks to the extraordinary efforts of our dedicated membership.

To parlay that effort, and for the benefit of all BOINC distributed computing projects, Team SETI.USAâ€™s commitment to extend beyond a single project has begun.

SETI.USA is now BOINCing the world! Join with us as we boldly go where no team has gone before!

Be sure to visit Our Home Page and join our community! You'll find team news and team graphics. If you need help setting up BOINC or joining our team, we have a friendly, active Message Board where our members are waiting to help.

Also, join us in our weekly evening of chat! Every Monday night at 8 PM CST.(2:00AM Tuesday UTC)
(server/channel info: irc://freenode/team_seti.usa)

Twitter
Facebook

team.name: BOINC Confederation
team.description:
Friendly team with dedicated members. We have a nice community, an amazing website, a growing wiki and a discussion forum ...

GemÃ¼tliches Team mit engagierten Leuten. Wir bieten eine nette Community, eine tolle Homepage, eine umfassende und schnell wachsende Wiki und ein Forum ...

team.name: L'Alliance Francophone
BOINC@Poland
team.description:
BOINC@Poland jest najstarszym polskim zespoÅ‚em zrzeszajÄ…cym najwiÄ™kszÄ… grupÄ™ w Polsce. Od 2004 roku jako jedyny zespÃ³Å‚ w Polsce umoÅ¼liwia wspieranie wszystkich projektÃ³w BOINC. BOINC@Poland stworzyÅ‚ rÃ³wnieÅ¼ wÅ‚asne projekty BOINC i znajduje siÄ™ w czoÅ‚Ã³wce zespoÅ‚Ã³w na Å›wiecie.

JeÅ¼eli doÅ‚Ä…czyÅ‚eÅ› do projektu TN-Grid i bÄ™dziesz potrzebowaÅ‚ wiÄ™cej informacji na jego temat albo BOINC lub innych projektÃ³w, znajdziesz je na Wiki BOINC@Poland. JeÅ¼eli bÄ™dziesz chciaÅ‚ moÅ¼esz rÃ³wnieÅ¼ odwiedziÄ‡ nasze forum, na ktÃ³rym codziennie uÅ¼ytkownicy zadajÄ… pytania, odpowiadajÄ… na nie i wymieniÄ… siÄ™ pomysÅ‚ami jak lepiej zmieniaÄ‡ Å›wiat za pomocÄ… platformy BOINC. Dla wielu czÅ‚onkÃ³w B@P wspieranie nauki za pomocÄ… platformy BOINC to najwiÄ™ksze hobby. DoÅ‚Ä…cz do nas, postaramy siÄ™ jak najsympatyczniej CiÄ™ przywitaÄ‡.

B@P na

team.name: [H]ard|OCP
team.description: [H]ard|OCP is a well known computer hardware website. The DC team is one of the biggest in the world in various projects and our goal is to contribute our resources to help science.

team.name: BOINCstats
team.description:
BOINCstats provides great user, host, team and country stats for all BOINC projects.

Also try BAM!, the BOINC Account Manager.

Team members have access to the private SOFA forums on BOINCstats.com, filled with useful information.

Stats: boincstats.com
Forum: boincstats.com/en/forum
BAM!: bam.boincstats.com

team.name: BOINC Synergy
team.description: We have a Fantastic Website, with stacks of features including Extended Stats, Forums, Signature Images, Synergy Emails, Synergy Toolbar, FAQs, Newsletter, and much much more! People rave about our stats! They are absolutely the best anywhere!

team.name: USA
team.description:
BOINC team USA for Citizens, Friends and Patriots of the United States of America

One of the long-standing traditions of distributed computing projects is the formation of teams.
Not just a tradition, a little healthy competition encourages active participation, to the general gain of the project.

BOINC team USA was created to show we have American pride and that good ol' American know-how is still a reality.
If you're a patriotic American, this is the team to join. Embrace our motto of "United we stand".
If you're not an American, you're still welcome. This has always been a country with open arms.

---------------------------------------
Visit our team forums.
Reading is free without registration.
Team members can register and will be granted access to additional private areas after verification of team membership.

----------------------------------------
20170107

team.name: BOINC United
team.description:
BOINC UNITED - an International Team participating in BOINC volunteer computing projects.

If you are supporting science then BOINC UNITED is the right team for you!

BOINC United is a unique, international TEAM open to all that are interested.

Combining our knowledge, having inspirational talks with our Members and helping out the scientific community by participating in various BOINC Projects.

Please make sure to visit us at our BOINC UNITED Homepage and our BOINC UNITED Forum!

Make sure to join us here at the project to be part of something special.

Together we can help:

and do many other types of very important research that helps the scientific community.

- enlarge our knowledge of physical properties of asteroids

- advance scientific research to cure diseases

- study global warming

- discover pulsars and detect gravitational waves

- map the milky way galaxy

- help to answer the big questions we have about the Universe

and do many other types of very important research that helps the scientific community.

Together we can make a difference!

team.name: ITI Marzotto - Valdagno
team.description: Team degli utenti dell'Istituto Tecnico Industriale "V.E. Marzotto" di Valdagno (VI) che partecipano al progetto gene@home. Fanno parte del team studenti, ex studenti e personale dell'ITI Marzotto.

team.name: AMD Users
team.description: The AMD Users team is a team for users of AMD processors. This doesn't mean that you have to have all AMD machines, but ethically you should have at least one. Of course you can still join us, because in the end all this is for a good cause.

team.name: BOINC@Heidelberg
team.description:
Wir sind das Team von BOINC@Heidelberg, dem sympathischen Team aus Deutschland fÃ¼r jedermann. Wir sind bei nahezu allen BOINC Projekten vertreten.

We are the team of BOINC@Heidelberg, the sympathic team from Germany for everyone. You can find us at almost every BOINC project around.

http://www.boinc-team.de

team.name: OcUK - Overclockers UK
team.description: A bunch of dedicated performance hardware enthusiasts who are proud to be part of The World's Finest Team.

team.name: SETI.Germany
team.description:
SETI.Germany ist das groesste deutsche Team beim wissenschaftlichen Projekt SETI@home, der Suche nach ausserirdischer Intelligenz, durchgefuehrt an der Universitaet von Kalifornien, Berkeley.

Neben Seti@home ist unser Team nun auch bei vielen anderen Projekten des Public Distributed Computing (Oeffentliches Verteiltes Rechnen) unter dem Namen SETI.Germany vertreten. Die Themen der Projekte reichen von Astrophysik und Molekularbiologie ueber Chemie, Mathematik, Medizin, Rendering, Verschluesselung bis zu angewandter Informatik.

Auf unserer Webseite bieten wir weiterfuehrende Informationen zu diesen Projekten u.a. in einem grossen Forensystem. Das Angebot fuer unsere Mitglieder und Gaeste umfasst ausserdem eine grosse Wiki, wo die meisten Projekte bereits aufgefuehrt sind, weiterhin eine Chatfunktion, ausfuehrliche Statistiken zu den meisten Projekten mit SETI.Germany-Beteiligung und mehr...

Weiterhin helfen wir dabei, die SETI@home Berechnung auf deinem PC zu optimieren, wodurch eine Beschleunigung der Berechnung von bis zu 40% moeglich wird.
Schau doch mal bei uns vorbei, wir helfen gerne weiter...

Folge uns bei Twitter oder schau auf unserer Facebook-Seite vorbei.

In diesen Projekten ist SETI.Germany aktiv:

team.name: Ars Technica
team.description: Representing Ars Technica, the best IT and tech news site on the web. For an impartial and intellectual overview of the IT world, and the best in technical discussion, make sure that we are your number one destination. We also have an extensive forum, covering every subject under the sun. If our expert advice can't help you, then nothing can. Be sure to check out the #distributed channel on our IRC server, irc.arstechnica.com What are you waiting for? Join the biggest and best distributed computing team on Earth today!

team.name: Everything2 Noders
USC Science
team.description: United Studios Corporation (USC) is a music organization, label and community. Official foundation date of USC is August 1st, 2005 in Moscow, Russian Federation. Its main task is to present works of associated authors to wide public. Our project is open for creative and interesting persons: musicians, designers, reviewers, publishers and event organizers. The main direction will always be publication and distribution of music, mainly electronic. USC Science is our division that will try to help science with our computing powers through BOINC.

team.name: Hardware Canucks
team.description: Canadian Computer Hardware Community

team.name: BlackOps
team.description:
Our Goal ... We strive to achieve our best with the equipment that we purchased out of our own pocket. We try to minimize the rules to the absolute minimum with
the aim of treating each other as you would love to be treated by somebody else. We do not wish to interfere in your own goal and acknowledge that you may do
with what you wish with your equipment and do your own thing. Collectively, your efforts will result in our overall team statistics ... To Join us ... If you are
a BOINC user and wish to join our Team & or Forum Registration is now open @ http://boincblackops.forumotion.com/ ... Please Note, You must use your current BOINC User
Name to Register so that we may allocate you to the right Group with appropriate permissions. This is necessary for security reasons. Failure to use your current
BOINC User Name & to identify you will result in your Registration not being accepted.

team.name: Portugal@Home
team.description: Portugal@Home no TN-Grid gene@home

team.name: Ukraine
team.description: Distributed computing team Ukraine!

team.name: Czech National Team
team.description:
JSME TYM LIDI KTERI SE SNAZI PROSTREDNICTVIM SVYCH POCITACU POMOCI VEDE.

Co vse v nasem tymu naleznete?
  • Tymove stranky - rozsahle informace o BOINC a jeho projektech v cestine
  • Clanky, odkazy, navody a tipy, download, ...
  • Velmi aktivni forum s diskuzemi vseho druhu (nejen o BOINC), vcetne anglicke sekce
  • Tymove statistiky a galerie
  • Minitymy - prestup celych tymu se zachovanim statistik
  • Tymova tricka, letaky, samolepky, ...
  • Lokalni i republikove tymove srazy a akce
  • Nektere clanky v anglictine
  • ...
Chcete-li nas podporit, pripojte se k nasemu tymu ve vsech BOINC projektech, ktere pocitate.

=========================================================

THE PEOPLE IN OUR TEAM ARE TRYING TO HELP SCIENCE BY UTILIZING THEIR COMPUTERS.

What will you find in our team?
  • Team pages - extensive information about BOINC and its projects in Czech
  • Articles, references, guides and hints, downloads, ...
  • Very active forum with discussions of all kinds (not only BOINC) including English section
  • Team statistics & Gallery
  • Miniteams - transfer of whole teams while keeping your stats
  • Team t-shirts, flyers, stickers, ...
  • Local and countrywide gatherings and events
  • Some articles in English
  • ...
If you'd like to give us your support, please join our team in all BOINC projects you crunch.

team.name: BRASIL

team.name: Boinc UK
team.description: Come and join Boinc UK, a great bunch of people who happen to also enjoy grid computing through Boinc. We participate in many projects and have a very informative user friendly forum with stats, team and individual milestones, information and help, Tech and Science chat and many other topics we find of interest. Crunchers from all countries are most welcome.

team.name: BOINC@AUSTRALIA
team.description:
Australians that want to participate in BOINC and give a definite Aussie Presence. Australians world wide are welcome and encouraged to join the #1 Aussie Alliance. As the song goes: Come on Aussie come on, come on.

BOINC@AUSTRALIA has a team in all the BOINC projects.

team.name: Microsoft
team.description: Current and former employees as well as any fans of Microsoft. Welcome all!

team.name: UK BOINC Team
team.description:
Our Team forum

Special Note: Some projects rely on donations as many do not receive state or corporate grants and without funds, the project can close. Please consider making a donation to help your favourite project to allow it to continue with its research

team.name: France
team.description:
Notre Ã©quipe a Ã©tÃ© crÃ©Ã©e pour regrouper et aider tous les franÃ§ais qui participent Ã  la recherche mÃ©dicale et scientifique. Ainsi, nous montrons que la France est bien prÃ©sente dans la recherche.

team.name: Team Biss!
team.description: Feel free to join this International team...for the good of humankind and science.

team.name: Cobar Spiders
team.description: So many projects, so few resources, still we help as much as we can. This is another worthy project that needs our help. Come join us in this quest.

team.name: Overclock.net
team.description: Come join the Official Overclock.net team. We overclock responsibly and contribute crazy amounts of processing power. We know our hardware in and out, and wanted to give back and share! All projects welcome.... It is a shame to have all this power and not put it to good use. That's why you should join our team!

team.name: Securiteinfo.com
team.description: french computer security team

team.name: Team Starfire World BOINC
team.description:
Team Starfire World BOINC is a small international team of long standing distributed computing enthusiasts and those new as well.

We have quite a few members into performance PCs and GPUs, open forums where we want everyone to feel comfortable. You'll find us to be a friendly and helpful group, to help you get started, solve any problem you may have, or join us in beta testing new projects.

We have a team IRC channel at irc://irc.64.107.140.250/team_starfire for our team and general talk.

We have teams for all projects and all interests, so drop in, say hello and hang out to see what we're about.

We have cookies!

team.name: The Scottish Boinc Team
team.description:
Welcome to The Scottish Boinc Team (established in 1999 as Scotland's Seti), one of the oldest and most successful BOINC teams crunching today. After joining the team on this project, head over to our Team Forum and join us. TSBT Team Forum .

We crunch for all current BOINC projects and are always at the forefront of adding new projects that start up within BOINC. Our aim is to use our spare or dedicated computing power to advance human knowledge while enjoying some friendly competition amongst ourselves and with other teams. If you want to be part of a lively, friendly team, please come join us, everyone is welcome.

Join the TSBT Team Forum. Take part in shaping your teams future, chat with other members, get help and advice or help others. We participate in all BOINCstats Team challenges and hold competitions both within our own team and with other rival teams. We maintain a very informative, user and newbie friendly, forum with our own team statistics, team and individual milestones, BOINC project and hardware information across all supported platforms and lots of help. Join us, you will be assured of a very warm welcome and it's easy to do.

Come along and visit our website .TSBT Team Website

Guests can read certain parts of the forum without registration. Registered members will be able to immediately post and be granted access to additional areas of the forum. Active TSBT members can gain access to the private team areas by request. Full instructions on joining are available along with the forum rules on the website. News updates from all active projects are also part of the forum along with other features in development.

team.name: Boinc Team Gruppe 2004
team.description: Dies ist das Team von der "Gruppe 2004" Neben diesem Projekt,beteilligen wir uns auch an andere BOINC-Projekte. Alle egal wo Ihr auch zuhause seid Ihr seid herzlichst dazu eingeladen bei unserem Team mit zumachen! Wir haben uns Zusammengeschlossen um mit zu arbeiten, Erfahrungen auszutauschen,etwas wichtiges tun, beteiligt zu sein,zu helfen...

team.name: Project Blue Book
team.description:
We're a "fun" group with international membership. We get started in September 1999 with the Classic SETI@Home Project. Everyone is Welcome!
"All your WU are Belong to Us!"

team.name: The Seekers Team
team.description: A Team for all BOINC Users around the world. You can come and go as you wish, crunch for other teams as long as you crunch at least one project for this team. All Nationalities are welcome. Our Forum will cater for your language as long as we have more than one user of your language.

team.name: Gridcoin
team.description: GridCoin is a new peer-to-peer internet based cryptocurrency that aims to provide real benefits to humanity by compensating the coin miners for participating in BOINC projects that may lead to advances in medicine, biology, mathematics, science, climatology, and astrophysics by concentrating a large percentage of the computational power towards BOINC research - instead of generating unnecessary heat and wasted power for the proof of work algorithms required to keep the coin network running. It is estimated that bitcoin is using approximately 23,312 megawatt hours per day (see electric consumption at blockchain.info/stats (24 hour stats)) of electric for block solving algorithms. The aim of the gridcoin project is to shift the computational power primarily to Boinc projects while the mining operations become a second priority - so as the network is scaled up, boinc utilization is scaled up in tandem. The coin miners will be rewarded with a small token subsidy if they fail to mine boinc shares, but a much larger subsidy when mining with boinc. This digital cryptocurrency allows instant peer to peer transactions, worldwide payments and very low processing fees. The source code is open source and allows everyone to take part in the success of the currency. Gridcoin is based on the Bitcoin protocol but differs from Bitcoin in that it can be efficiently mined with consumer-grade hardware, therefore is not as likely to be replaced by specialized ASIC mining chips in the future. Gridcoin provides faster transaction confirmations (2.5 minutes on average) and uses memory intensive scrypt-based proof-of-work algorithms to verify transactions.

team.name: OZ Crunchers
team.description: OZ Crunchers - The Crunchers from down under.

team.name: The Planetary Society
team.description: <center>Members and Friends of The Planetary Society See our hierarchical listing at the BOINC Synergy site</center>

team.description: Distributed Computing with a Twist!

team.name: SETIKAH@KOREA
team.description:
BOINC + SETI + KOREA + FOLDING + @HOME
[ SETIKAH@KOREA ]
"A BETTER WORLD BEGINS AT HOME"

team.name: CANAL@Boinc
team.description:
Bienvenido a CANAL@Boinc, el primer equipo de boinc hispano.

Toda la ayuda que necesites, todas las dudas que tengas, todas las preguntas que siempre quisiste hacer, podras hacerlo en el foro sobre Computacion Distribuida en espaÃ±ol mas participativo y ameno de la red. Unete a nosotros y aporta tu granito de arena por la ciencia con el mejor equipo de habla hispana.

Estamos presentes en los siguientes proyectos en prÃ¡cticamente todos los proyectos para Boinc.
Mas informaciÃ³n en el foro del equipo: www.canalboinc.com

Contacto: administracion@canalboinc.com

team.name: Russia
team.description: The Team for all from Russia and ex-USSR.

team.name: Planet 3DNow!
team.description:
Von seinen Mitgliedern nur liebevoll â€žder GrÃ¼ne Planetâ€œ genannt, gehÃ¶rt das Distributed-Computing-Team der Hardware-Community Planet 3DNow! zu den grÃ¶ÃŸten weltweit und leistet damit einen maÃŸgeblichen Beitrag zur FÃ¶rderung wissenschaftlicher Arbeit durch unentgeltliche Bereitstellung von Rechenleistung im Sinne der Allgemeinheit.

Wir fÃ¶rdern Projekte im medizinischen und bioinformatischen Bereich, Quantenchemie und Nanotechnik, bis hin zur Astrophysik und Mathematik. Unser Ziel ist es, die MÃ¶glichkeiten des verteilten Rechnens aufzuzeigen, seine Verbreitung voranzutreiben und den Bekanntheitsgrad zu steigern. Distributed Computing ist schlieÃŸlich mehr als nur ein Konzept, denn es bringt Menschen zusammen, die sich gemeinsam fÃ¼r eine gute Sache engagieren.

Wir, das Team von Planet 3DNow!, sind als lebendiger Teil dieser Kultur bekannt, und bieten unseren Mitgliedern eine umfassende Diskussionsplattform zur Entfaltung ihrer Interessen. Dass der SpaÃŸ dabei nicht zu kurz kommt, zeigen zum Beispiel unsere freundschaftlichen WettkÃ¤mpfe mit den Teams von SETI.USA oder der Electronic Sports League. Schaut doch einfach mal bei uns vorbei, und Ã¼berzeugt euch selbst.

In diesem Sinne: Herzlich Willkommen auf dem GrÃ¼nen Planeten!

Links:

Planet 3DNow!
Forum Planet 3DNow!
Forum Planet 3DNow! - Distributed Computing

English:

Lovingly called â€žThe Green Planetâ€œ by its supporters and team members, Planet 3DNow!â€™s distributed computing division is one of the biggest teams worldwide, and it invests a great deal of computing power in order to support scientific projects for the public good.

From medicine to bioinformatics, from quantum chemistry to nanotechnology, and from astrophysics to math, we support all projects equally. Our self-defined mission is to highlight the possibilities that distributed computing can offer and to promote distributed computing in order to enhance its public level of awareness. After all, distributed computing is more than simply a theoretically constructed concept â€“ it teams people in good cause.

We are a vital part of this culture, and we offer our members an extensive community platform to discuss and unfold distributed computing interests. And since having fun is also part of our understanding of distributed computing, we regularly arrange amicable competitions with teams like SETI.USA or the Electronic Sports League. Just stop by and have a look, you might like it.
The Green Planet puts forth a warm welcome to all our visitors.

team.name: FireFighters XTreme
team.description: FireFighters XTreme

team.name: Anguillan Pirates
team.description:
Welcome to Anguillan Pirates ( established in 2014 ) This is the Pirate hideout for projects and competitions of Anguillan Pirate crunchers. We pirates can be found at our forum we share with The Scottish Boinc TeamTSBT Forum

Most members of Anguillan Pirates regard The Scottish Boinc Team as our home team, since we freely swap membership between the two teams depending on projects or challenges we are completing or competing in. Both teams crunch for all Boinc projects and are always adding new ones as they come along. Our aim is to use our spare computing power to advance human knowledge while enjoying some friendly competition amongst ourselves and with other teams. So if you fancy being part of a lively friendly team, please come join us, everyone is welcome

Visit our home webpage. Take part in shaping your team, chat, get help and advice or help others. Participate in Team challenges and competitions both with ourselves and other rival teams. It's a very informative, user and newbie friendly, forum with stats, team and individual milestones, information and lots of help. Come join us, you will be assured of a warm welcome and it's easy to do.

You can read a large part of the forum without registration. Team members of Anguillan Pirates or The Scottish Boinc Team can Register and will be able to immediately post and be granted access to additional private team areas.

team.name: Bro.Inc
Crunching@EVGA
team.description: A Fellowship of All Walks of Life Looking to Improve Our Communities' Future One Byte at a Time...

team.name: Picard
team.description: A friendly group of lunatics united by a common interest in distributed computing and Star Trek

team.name: Christians
team.description: Followers of Jesus. Hardware enthusiasts. Dedicated to helping humanity, advancing science, and having fun.

team.name: Entropizados
team.description:
Bienvenido a una forma de vida caÃ³tica, ligada a la propia degeneraciÃ³n entrÃ³pica del pensamiento y la casualidad humana. Ãšnete a nosotros y camina por la Red siguiendo una senda regida por nuevas pautas, lejos de normas sociales externas, bajo una entropÃ­a en la que *vosotros* sois la clave para avanzar, tanto en Boinc como en las nuevas fronteras del mundo virtual.


Entropizados.com - equipo Boinc - foros - blogs - chat
Y en exclusiva, el primer eBook de Javier Paredes: Amaneceres

team.description: We are SETI@Netherlands and our goals are simple: 1. Find ET 2. Show the world The Netherlands rocks! ;)

team.name: TeAm AnandTech
team.description: Welcome to TeAm AnandTech! Here you will find plenty of great folks who would be glad to help you with the technical side of setting up and running distributed computing applications. You will find people who are more passionate about numbers than some mathematicians. You will find a great community who enjoy having [slightly] off topic discussions and helping each other immensely in real life. Some projects look outward into space, to look for extraterrestrial life, pulsars, and other things. Others look around, to chart the development of life on the planet, or predict future weather patterns. Yet others look inward, to analyze the structure of atoms, molecules, or proteins. Each project can have a great impact on the development of science in its area, and you can help!

team.name: SwissTeam.NET
team.description:
The SwissTeam.NET is founded in 1997.

We are participating a lot of different projects as LHC, climateprediction, MalariaControl.Net, SETI@home, Muon, Chessbrain and many more.


We are a mixed group of students, sysadmins, retired persons and so on.


If you want contact us write a message in our webforum.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -


Das SwissTeam.NET wurde 1997 gegrÃ¼ndet.

Wir beteiligen uns an vielen unterschiedlichen Projekten, im englischen Text siehst Du einige Projekte als Beispiel.


Wir sind eine Gruppe aus unterschiedlichsten Sparten, z.B. Studenten, Systemadministratoren, Pensionierten und vielen weiteren.


Wenn Du uns kontaktieren willst, so schreibe in unser Disskusionsforum.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -


Le SwissTeam.NET a Ã©tÃ© fondÃ© en 1997.

Nous participons Ã  beaucoup de projets diffÃ©rents, comme LHC, climateprediction, MalariaControl.Net, SETI@home, Muon, Chessbrain et encore beaucoup d'autres.


Nous sommes un groupe de provenances diffÃ©rentes, par exemple des Ã©tudiants, des administrateurs de systÃ¨me, des retraitÃ©s et ainsi de suite.


Si vous dÃ©sirez prendre contact avec nous, alors Ã©crivez un message dans notre forum de discussion.

team.name: Smart Patrol
team.description: Smart Patrol . . . Know where to go . . . Suburban robots that monitor reality _ _ _ _ Sorry, we can't stop . . . We work around the clock . . . We shot the b1ts through the n0ughts _ _ _ _ Mr. DNA is getting dressed . . . Watch him put his genes on! _ _ _ _ _ _ _ [We are a nation of nerds and geeks. However, ALL are welcome to join: dorks, dweebs, ninnies, and twits included. For issues regarding superfluous toes, please contact the evolutionary subcommittee on phenotypic anomalies. There is no FAQ. In general, a total of 11 toes or less is acceptable.] â€” â€” â€” â€” â€” > Remember: Always evaluate to True.

team.name: Charity Team
team.description:
Hello Crunchers worldwide!

The Charity Team was created in 2009 to have a common Team that everyone can join during the annual Charity Race.

Please joins us in the next Charity Race which will happen 2017 at TN-Grid.



Charity Team at TN-Grid

Charity Forum. (Please use a Nickname known at any BOINC Statistics Website as we switched to "approval needed" as Sign-up Method to prevent from Spammers. Every new Username is crosschecked manually, so please bear with us if it takes a Day or two...)
